radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal cardiac silhouette and clear lungs.
Ill-defined mass (9.0 cm by 5.6 cm) in the right lobe of the liver, with no evidence of dilatation of intrahepatic bile ducts.

Multiple prominent cardiophrenic lymph nodes (≤1 cm in maximal short-axis diameter) predominantly on the right side, multiple enlarged axillary lymph nodes (≤3.4 cm in maximal short-axis diameter), some with central necrosis.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple ill-defined hypodensities in the right lobe and in the fourth segment of the liver, largest measuring 2.7 cm by 2.0 cm; trace perihepatic ascites and mild splenomegaly (spleen measuring 13.5 cm in craniocaudal dimension).

Multiple areas of abnormality in the right lobe that corresponded to lesions seen on CT, largest measuring 3.1 cm by 6.3 cm by 3.5 cm; lesions demonstrated mild peripheral hyper-intensity and restricted diffusion, with peripheral enhancement and central hypoenhancement.
